results.title: Itzhak Perlman: Beethoven violin concerto in D, op. 61
results.brief_description: This video recording of Beethoven’s violin concerto in D, op. 61 was produced in the studio and features the exquisite music of Israeli born violin virtuoso, Itzhak Perlman accompanied by the Philharmonia Orchestra (leader, Carl Pini) and world-renowned conductor, Carlo Maria Giulini.

results.title: Its water cycle
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
Shows clouds massing and evaporating, ice crystals growing under photomicrography, and air and water under varying pressures in a plastic box, in order to illustrate the hydrologic or evaporation-condensation-precipitation cycle.

results.title: Its oceans
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
A comprehensive study, revealing the changing pattern of the ocean’s surface, the living and non-living things in the waters, the nature of the ocean floor, and the influence of the oceans on man. The roles of modern scientists - oceanographers, marine biologists and others - as they work to gain more knowledge of the earth’s vast, deep oceans.

results.title: Italy: where the past is always present
results.brief_description: Gives historical overview and examines the Italian influence on civilisation through the ages, from the rise and fall of the Roman Empire, through the Renaissance to postwar industrialisation. Looks at present day Italy and the Italian love of life and considers social and political problems such as the gap between north and south.

results.title: Italy: the land and the people
results.brief_description: This film depicts the agriculture, industry, and principle cities and culture of Italy, from the fertile Po Valley in the north, south along the Apennines and adjacent coastal land to the islands of Sicily and Sardinia. Emphasises new industrial growth in the sixties and participation in the European community.

results.title: Italy: a Venetian menu
results.creator_credit: Screenscope Productions, Marilyn Weiner and Hal Weiner
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
In Venice eating is an event, and master chef Giovanni Giero shows you why. With great aplomb he prepares sauces, scampi, pasta and more. Filmed in and around the beautiful city of Venice.

results.title: Italy today
results.brief_description: Via powerful imagery, this film shows strong contrasts between the wealthy industrial cities of Italy’s north, and the time honoured customs of the poor farmers in the south during the seventies. The agriculture and the industries of each area are examined and possible solutions for the South’s problems are discussed.

results.title: Italy
results.brief_description: Informative film which visits the cities and towns of Italy. A geographical overview is given and aspects of Italian life are looked at, such as the importance of religion and cultural differences between north and south. Visits Milan, Naples, Rome and the Vatican. Historical reviews of places are given, including Pompeii. Looks at wine, olive, fruit and pasta production and the contributions that Italy makes to design, furniture, clothes and the car industry.

results.title: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian
results.creator_credit: BBC Books and Denise De Rome
results.brief_description: The course book is divided into two levels, each of five units. Each unit contains conversations, key phrases, language patterns and a variety of exercises, including special vocabulary building sections. Each level is followed by grammar summaries, additional exercises and a “Cultura” section introducing some Italian paintings and poetry. The book accompanies the video and audio cassettes which may be borrowed as separate loan items.
results.title_for_label: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian

Each level is followed by grammar summaries, additional exercises and a “Cultura” section introducing some Italian paintings and poetry. The book accompanies the video and audio cassettes which may be borrowed as separate loan items.

results.title: Italianissimo 2: intermediate: a multimedia course for learning Italian
results.brief_description: This set of audio cassettes contain all the conversations from the course book as well as ten profile interviews recorded in Italy for the course. Learners are encouraged to take part in the conversational activities intended to develop their ability to understand and speak Italian. The cassettes are designed to be used with the course book, but can be used independently. The course book and videos may be borrowed as separate loan items.
